meanings.definition: A person who engages in the act of programming.
meanings.sent1: The talented progger developed a new app for his company.
meanings.sent2: The progger sat at the computer coding all day.
meanings.sent3: The progger joked that debugging code was like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: She was a wizard with numbers, a true progger in the digital realm.
meanings.sent5: The progger's passion for coding shone through in every project.

meanings.definition: To engage in the act of programming.
meanings.sent1: I will progger the software to make it more efficient.
meanings.sent2: She loves to progger late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to progger together to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent4: His mind began to progger with ideas as soon as he sat down at the computer.
meanings.sent5: They proggered tirelessly to bring their innovative idea to life.
